com.octo.android.robospice
Class SpiceActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  com.octo.android.robospice.SpiceActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public class SpiceActivity
extends android.app.Activity

This class is more a sample than a real ready-to-use class. It shows how you can build your base Activity class in your own project. Whatever super class you use (sherlock, fragmentactivity, guice, etc.) you can just copy past the methods below to enable all your activities to use the framework. The binding can take place, at best during certain lifecycle operations : onStart() and onStop().

Author:
sni
